ai.summary: Lime Tree Walk is a short, easy 0.8 km stroll in the United Kingdom that invites visitors to enjoy a calm, leafy pathway lined with lime trees. Ideal for families, casual walkers, or anyone seeking a quick nature break close to urban areas.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily flat and well-maintained paths. The route is generally stroller-friendly with compact surfaces, but expect occasional gravel, roots, or damp patches after rain. Signposted turns and benches may be along the way.
ai.safety_notes: - Suitable for all ages and most fitness levels. - Wear sturdy footwear and bring a light layer in case of weather changes. - Watch for uneven surfaces, roots, and muddy patches after rain. - Stay on marked paths and respect posted signs. - Keep an eye on small children and pets; do not approach wildlife or invasive vegetation. - In crowded times, be mindful of other walkers, bicyclists, and accessibility needs.
recommended_gear: Light weather-appropriate clothing or a small layer
Sunscreen and hat for sunny days
Mobile phone with a map or offline navigation
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with peak experience in late spring to early summer when lime trees are in bloom.

seo.title: Lime Tree Walk – Easy 0.8 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Lime Tree Walk, a short and easy 0.8 km hike in the UK. Flat paths, lime trees, and a tranquil urban nature escape—great for families and beginners.
seo.h1: Lime Tree Walk – Easy 0.8 km Hike in the UK
